If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll, Eric Campbell, and George Wood with enough bad guys to necessitate the need for stuntmen, this is a non-stop dish of heavily seasoned excitement. 'The Durango Kid' (Carroll) is a wandering dude ranch affected cowboy. He keeps things on the peaceful

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat-loving elderly neighbor, a depressed young adoptive sister, and a recurring nightmare. A terrific dark fairy tale based on the Stephen King novella and shot in Vancouver, British Columbia.
